intro: Dimeria psilobasis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved dimeria, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheat and sorrel, and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and clusters of small, greenish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its botanical features include a short, stout stem and leaves that are narrow and often covered with fine hairs.
